description:
Went to San Francisco to grab a drink and was going to go to a bowling alley across fron ATT stadium.  When we parked we noticed tgis pub we were next to.  We decided to go there instead and I was glad we made that choice.  When we came in it was a nice atmosphere with clean and friendly staff.  Kyle, one of the bartenders was very nice and conversational.  My hubby and I both orderd  our drinks and found out, that despite it being 10 pm, they were still serving food.  This is unusual for bars/pubs but apparently they are known for their food.  Here is what we ordered:

Steak Street Tacos:  you can't mess this up.  It was delicious and not oily.  The salsa was yummy too.

Side order of tater tots: don't let the name fool you.   This is a large platter of ever crispy tater tots, not oily either.  Comes with nacho cheese and their special spicy ketchup.   

Buffalo wings:  the chicken was meaty and their buffalo sauce....DELISH!

Just these 3 things and we couldn't finish the food.  They were all good and big portions.   Good enough for 3 people.  

Also while we were there, there were so many take out orders of their burgers which is what Kyle saud is most popular.  Will definitely go back to try other food out.  Oh, and on different nights they have events that go on! Check it out, you will be pleasantly surprised.
author: Cecilia D.

description:
After bar hopping in South Beach, my group of four wanted to do one last stop. After yelping bars nearby, we decided to check out Polo Grounds. We arrived on Friday, May 11th around 11:15pm. It wasn't too busy, so we easily found four seats at the bar.

For the first round, I believe some started with Jameson on the rocks (or Jameson and ginger?) while my girlfriend and I had Bulleit Rye on the rocks. Both were somewhat normal pours. (Maybe a little smaller than the standard pour?) After having several cocktails throughout the evening, this was a good way to end the night. For our second round, my friend ordered everyone a Jameson neat. By then I didn't want to drink anymore, but I never waste, so I managed to finish the shot.

The bar itself is very laid back. It's a pretty good size and that night, there weren't many people here, so we were all able to catch up and talk while sipping on our drinks. The bartender was nice and attentive when needed.

Decent bar to wrap up our Friday. Good for whiskey sipping and catching up on a low key night.
author: Elena N.

description: Came here to get some food before a Giants game. It was pretty good for bar food and the staff was quick and attentive. I really appreciated that they had a burger option that wasn't beef.
author: Jessica C.

description: They charged my credit card an additional 15% fee prior to giving me the bill. When I asked why the waiter told me they do that on a 'random' basis.
author: Mark M.

description:
Always come in here after giants games and get some beers or the awesome nachos. 

Came in after the giants parade in 2014 with my dad which will always be a dear memory for me. 

Recently stopped in for a beer after my birthday dinner and it was trivia night which was cool, as we love trivia. Stayed for a few beers and had a good time as always. 

Will continue to come here for good times.
author: Destinie Z.

description:
Brunch review: 
I bought a Groupon for two entrees and bottomless mimosas. I was also required to order something else so we picked the fries. I think they were about $7 for a huge portion. I had to take them home with my food. Usually, when I purchase a Groupon I try to keep my expectations low. I was very pleasantly surprised! The food was yummy and mimosas strong. We had to walk up to the bar for a few refills but I didn't mind because it was a slow day and there was only one guy serving and bar tending. I definitely plan on returning when there's a Giants game or for brunch!
author: Lauren D.

description: Super fun bar, walking distance from the stadium! This place is everything you ever wanted in a bar. Fancy new juke box, friendly bouncers, clean bathrooms and great bartenders. The neighborhood seems safe for walking around. The bar had older furnishing but clean and welcoming. There is plenty of space to move around (or dance if that's your thing) and plenty of seating if you just want to hang out and chill. I came with a large party and both the patrons and staff were very friendly. Our drinks were fast and accurate and the pricing was great. Shera helped our big group for the night and she was amazing! Hands down one of the best bartenders of all time! Especially great at managing multiple drink orders and tabs and customers at once while staying fast and accurate, fun and friendly! She made our night! Great place for drinks in the city!
author: Jennie J.

description:
This is a great dive bar to go to before the game. Be warned, it is very busy before the game and as soon as the game starts, it's back to empty. 
Stopped by here with a group and we were lucky to grab a table in the back. I do appreciate that they leave the tables for those who are ordering food. We got the pupu platter, tots and shots! 
Shots are very reasonably prices, especially since you are so close to the park. The tots are amazing! So crispy & crunchy. The pupu platter was interesting lol. They had 2 types of wings, which were great (even 2 dipping sauces). There were more tots in the platter. However, there was an odd meat eggroll type thing. The crust wasn't as crispy and the meat was not great. 
Other than that, i would definitely stop by here again.
author: Sarika S.

description: Screw this place. Proximity to the ballpark, decent beer selection, and TVs aren't worth getting verbally abused by the female bartender and macho bouncer.
author: Shekhar K.

description: I am a security guard across the street from the Polo Grounds.  My co worker and I decided to order some take out.  We ordered the Nachos and Chicken Tenders.  The food was delicious however when I went to check my bank account today I noticed the bartender added a few dollars to my bill, I am assuming this was for her tip. I don't have a problem leaving a tip if I was eating there or having drinks but I think adding $$$ to some one bill is just not COOL specially if they are just picking up food. I will make sure to let all my co workers know that this is happening there.
author: Mike O.

description: Coming from out of town and the place was empty after the Baseball game. We had to wait till 11pm to "see" if we could use the pool table that was run by the DoorMan. The bar tender said I run behind the bar he runs everything else.WTF we finally got the pool table only to put 20$ in the karaoke machine that was never played in the 3hrs that we were there. Total bust DO NOT RECOMMEND
author: Rachel R.

description: Mediocre at best. Just a one big ehhh. For the price this place does not meet up to expectations. The chicken tenders, wings, and chili are all below average and there's nothing to be excited about or make this place memorable. That being said the atmosphere is nice and seems to be a comfortable place to sit back and have a drink.
author: Amir K.

description:
Stopped by for a few drinks with co-workers since it's a few blocks from our office. Can't believe I've never been here before! If you know me, you know anything dive-ish is my wheel house. It has a darker pub kind of feel but with a ton of room. They also have a pool table and pinball machine in a separate room which is awesome. Can't even tell you how many times I've walked into a bar and had to divert my path because of the pool table haha.

The place was about half full at 5:30. We ordered some beers and played a few games of pool. $1 a game and they give you quarters at the bar. The pool table was pretty dirty and there was no chalk so that was annoying, but oh well...

They were also out of guinness so we couldn't do the "bomb" drinks that some wanted, soo that was annoying too, but not enough for me to not come back. Plenty of other things to order!! The bartender was super attentive and nice too.

The chicken nachos were pretty bomb topped with fresh jalapeños, tomatoes and chunks of avocado. Those were tasty!

Happy hour from 4-9 $1 off well drinks and beers. It's a nice change from the more upscale places in the surrounding area. I guess I'm not too hard to impress when it comes to some places. :)
author: Heather H.

description:
I can't believe baseball season is practically over and we just found this place. 
Simple pub grub,  really crispy tater tots,  3 street tacos (beef,  chicken or adobo pork,  do no miss the chef's amaze-rolls (tender and juicy adobo pork wrapped and fried only a flour tortilla).
My martini was great. There's a large selection of beer on tap and in bottles. 
The service was friendly and prompt.  Plenty of televisions to keep track of the game and walking distance to the ball park. 
Definitely will go again.
author: Joy G.

description:
A great little semi-divey/no-frills bar right across from AT&T Park. A decent selection of beers (including many awesome local ones). And the menu has a fair number of pub-food options.

I had the buffalo chicken sandwich and paid extra for the side of chili. My meal was excellent! The sandwich had big chunks of lightly fried chicken with a little bit of buffalo sauce, along with lettuce and tomato. The French roll was soft and chewy, just the way I like it. I asked for extra hot sauce because the chicken was a tad dry, but adding that on made the sandwich perfect. And the chili, boy-howdy, that was some of the best chili I've had outside TX (and better than plenty I've had inside the Great Republic!). It was a decent-sized cup as a side, it was hearty, meaty, thick, with beans, meat, and onions. It had a little bit of a kick of spice, just enough to make my mouth tingle a bit.

I had a couple beers, which were solid. I also ordered a cocktail which was not great and about twice what I would have expected to pay for such a drink. So, moral of the story: don't get a cocktail here.

All in all it was a great bar with great beer and food, just don't get a "fancy" cocktail (i.e., shots or 2 ingredients max). I'll absolutely be back to try more of the food menu and to just chill (plus they have daily specials and trivia on Thursday!). I'm sure I'll venture here on a Giants gameday someday...once I get up the courage!
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Note- I am a regular here and am not saying anything bad about this place in general, their chicken club sandwich and fries are amazing but this review is for our recent brunch visit. 

I got the bottomless mimosa and a BBQ burger. I wanted so badly to love the burger but the meat is totally unseasoned and more importantly I'm pissed off because I watched the bartenders mix the mimosas into the pitcher.. half champagne half OJ+ soda water. This makes me sad, it's the definition of watering down drinks. I had 6 glasses within the 2 hours I was there and had to order a couple shots just to feel any buzz. Management, please stop doing this.. I understand it's more cost efficient but it's not fair to your customers who could easily go to Local Tap or Chieftan nearby for REAL bottomless mimosas.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Had some good pregame beers here while taking in the Wyoming football game replay from over the weekend.

The Polo Grounds, the name essentially calls all Giants fans to come in and grab a COLD BEER. 

I was around the area before the start of the the Giants game yesterday and was itching for a beer. I had to choose either here or Momos. From the horror stories that I have heard about Momos I knew exactly where I was heading. 

I walked in and found this place exactly as how I imagined. Couple of suits and then the rest seemed like patrons. I walked up the counter and order a beer and then took my seat. The first thing I noticed is that there are no stools near the windows for sitting. I guess you are suppose to stand and drink your beer if you are over there, hmmm, ok.

The bartender seemed nice enough. Asked if I wanted to open a tab and I told her no. I am more of a cash guy. In carrying cash you don't spend in excess!!! Cash limits mean moderation and control. Remember that for all you young and underage drinker. Well, if you are underage you probably think you know everything anyway so don't even worry about it. 

As far as the entertainment, there are several TV's inside and they constantly have them going. I think I counted somewhere around 4 TV's I think, maybe more. 

There is an awesome piece of Giants artwork on the wall on the right corner here. 

There was one gentleman that came in that left disgruntled. He came in and sat at the bar but was never greeted or served. I saw him sit for approximately 15 minutes. I do not know where the bartenders were but they were no where to be found. I felt bad for the guy.

Also, there was a guy and girl that came in and the dude was just odd. He kept lifting his shirt and talking very LOUDLY!! Eventually he and his friend descended to a booth but he was just no appropriate for this place. The sad thing about it is that he seemed like a regular. 

Eventually as it closer to game time more people came in. A family even came in with their baby. It was weird seeing a baby in a pub but they also serve food so it's okay, I GUESS!!! 

The pricing of the beer here is decent. Nothing too obscure in the pricing of the beers or well drinks. 

I will return again at some point. Oh, and nobody bothers you too much either. At least in the early afternoon, I don't know about at night.
author: Robert F.

description: Best pub food I've ever had in the city, seriously. Folks were visiting and we decided to grab an early dinner before the Giants game. First off, be prepared, because their cocktails are damn strong. I ordered the Blueberry Lemonade Vodka something-or-other. Not only was it delicious but boy buddy, shit hit me quick!!! When the server came back I got another and was smashed before 5. Then I ordered onion skins and sweet garlic wings for us, and boyyy those did not last! Chicken was tender and juicy, sauce on it was to die for, and those onion strings were sooo delicious, especially dipped with ranch! We should have ordered two for our table of five, but our entrees came out and those were so worth the wait! I got the amaze-rolls, which reminded us of lumpia but stuffed with pulled pork and super crispy on the outside. The rolls were drizzled with chipotle and had a dipping sauce that reminded me slightly of the sweet chili sauce we usually use at home for egg rolls. It might've been, I was too drunk to tell. My dad kept reaching over and grabbing my food, because, don't get me wrong, his Asian Ginger Chicken Sesame salad was apparently very good, but my Amaze-rolls were irresistible! Mom and Nana had pulled pork sandwiches that were very tasty, and my aunt ordered a chicken club that was also impressive. Place is pretty cozy, come here before or after, or even during the game to watch it on tv! I will return. For everything.
author: Justine K.

description: Came here on a Thursday night after bowling with a few friends and as soon as I walked in I was immediately impressed by the music selection. Because who doesn't love 90s hip hop. We had a pretty big group and took up the whole left side of the bar and was helped by the bartender, Ryan. The mixed drinks seem like weird combos (crown royal and cranberry for example) but I tried a few (kamikaze, vegas bomb) and they tasted amazing. Ryan was like salt bae with those drinks. Plus he was super nice. I never go out, but when I do I feel like bartenders are either jerks or super cool. He was just super cool. It's a really laid back place that I would say is pretty affordable considering the location. Will I go back? Yes!
author: nastasha s.

description:
I dropped in for a drink at approx. 7:00  PM on a  quiet Sat. evening on 11/4 with a friend after missing CalTrain. We weren't looking for a sports bar, just a drink, and even though the bar was almost empty, the TV was blasting at full volume. When I asked the bartender if he could lower the volume, he at first reminded us that it was a sports bar, but said he would turn it down. It didn't sound any different but we went ahead and order drinks. When I mentioned the volume again, he again reminded me that it was a sports. I gave up at this point, however, a large, loud-mouthed manager then stepped into the fray and proceeded to berate me for harassing the bartender (who, unlike the manager, behaved professionally), and became abusive. At which point, we left our drinks on the bar and walked across the street to Public House, which also happened to be a sports bar with multiple screens and a sound system than was less intrusive. 

While I could have tolerated the volume for the duration of one drink, the verbal abuse was intolerable, unprofessional and above all, sexist.
author: sf k.

description:
A fun spot for Thursday night trivia, with an ok selection of beers and THE BEST (pub-style) buffalo tenders I've had in the city. They're comfort-food good. Make sure to ask for tater tots with your order instead of fries - it makes all the difference. :)

The staff are cool and down-to-earth, but they usually seem overwhelmed and/or under-staffed. If you don't mind waiting a bit, it's not a problem.
author: Catie F.

description: I typically hang out in the Castro . I accidentally stumbled into polo grounds one Sunday night. It was empty. I ordered a drink and some grub. The bartender Brittany .. It was here first night.  It was quite. She said I hope it's not always this way. After, that I made it a point to stop in on Sunday's.. Ugh the bar is packed! People are having a great time. Who ever hired Brittany needs a raise .
author: Jason P.

description:
An A-OK bar that is conveniently a block away from AT&T Park! For $8, you can get beer or a shot. For $10, you can pick between a few choices of bomb drinks (shot and another liquid). 

Besides bar seating, they also have booths and individual tables. There are tons of people pre-gaming here before the Giants game. And there are tons of people who are staying at the bar to watch the game. 

They have a jukebox, which is kind of cool. But they put up a sign that says if there's a (I'm assuming, local team) game on, they don't allow people to use it so people can watch the game.

They have different happy hour deals everyday, so ch-ch-check it out!
author: Christine S.

description: Great dive near the ballpark for bar food and drinks. My colleagues kept raving about the food. Then again, almost everything was fried. Haha. Chicken tenders and nachos were my favorite. They have several beers on draft and wine on tap!
author: Patricia N.

description:
After a long day at work, a couple coworkers and I took the bus to Polo Grounds for their weekly trivia night on Thursday's at 7PM. Thankfully, no Giants game on that day so the bar was full, but not crazy.

I'm not usually a big trivia fan, but I had an awesome time at Polo Grounds. The atmosphere was very chill and relaxing which was much needed. The bar is fairly standard with their offerings, but they do have a decent selection of food to go along with drinks. Most of the food on the menu was around $10 and beers around $6 (which is not bad). Also there is plenty of seating so bring lots of friends to join your team!

If you are looking for a good place to unwind on a Thursday night, Polo Grounds is the place to be. Great atmosphere and fun times.
author: Derek L.

description:
"what do you want to do tonight? OH! LETS GO TO POLO GROUNDS!"

said nobody, ever.... probably.

PG is a stop, not a destination. Off the beaten path and nestled between a McDonalds and Happy Donut (should I just stop there? Nah).

This is one of those places that you pop into when you're in the neighborhood whether it's for a giants game, bowling with coworkers or you just bailed out of 850 Bryant; I don't judge.

Walking in, you're greeted by security (still figuring that one out.... Especially on non-game days) and you're immediately at the bar. There are tons of TVs, tables with standard bar food and even a back room with tables. Great beers on tap at a low price point and quick service.

What makes polo grounds different is one of their bartenders, Ryan. Ryan and I go back.... like way back. okay, maybe 3 years.... But by SF standards that's a long-term relationship. Hell, we should be living together by now! Ryan is fast, engaging and super fun to talk to..... oh, and loves fernet. Note to management: this man is singlehandedly keeping your lights on and is the sole reason I (and many) come here. If there was a tinder for bartenders, he would be super-liked. yeah, I took it there.

That said, shout out to Michael too. Popped in here on Sunday after brunch in SoMa looking for Ryan and we chatted up a bit. He introduced me to the "undecided bartender" shot which is half Jameson, half fernet. I was verbally disgusted yet pleasantly surprised when it hit the lips.... Definitely a go-to from this point on. It's a bummer he will no longer be there anymore but glad to have met him.

Polo grounds, keep doing yo thang! You're holding it down despite all these swanky try-hard "mixology" bars that are popping up in the hood.

Tips: 
- avoid on games days. It's too crazy. if you must, get there early to score a seat.
- Taco bell cantina across the street. That's an experience in itself.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Come here a decent amount since it's right by my apartment. The bartenders are awesome, always friendly and do a great job. The food is also good. I ordered mac and cheese the other day (not the best mac i've had but it definitely satisfied my craving). The mac is LOADED. It comes with bacon, jalepenos, onions, and tomatoes. I passed on the bacon and jalepenos, but maybe the mac would've been better if I hadn't. Who knows.

They have a good beer selection and a good specialty drink/shot selection. Very busy on game days but also very fun! You'll probably end up standing but that shouldn't be too surprising since it's right across from AT&T park. Will definitely keep coming back here!
author: Ilana B.

description: Best place for a burger, fries and a draft beer with great bartenders that won't break the bank! Their burgers are large, beef, bacon, avocado and a fried egg! Amazing taste!
author: John N.

description: Honesty! It is what it is!if you're looking for a good sports bar when the SF teams are not winning, this is it! Let's face it, SF isn't a sports city. Half the city is not from here so don't expect more. BUT, when you want a good drink, some reg good pub food, good convo from a bartender, this is it! You know you're not talking to Jesus Christ, but at least you're having fun, expected good pub food, and the balls to talk to a new person and play pool! That's what's here! FYI, the house chips are great with a drink! Trust! This could be fun! FYI, you from LA, start here to dive into SF life, #learn
author: J M.

description: Was not here during baseball season. No frills bar with food. 8-9 TV's on the walls. I was here on a Monday night and it was quiet.
author: David Z.

description: If you think about purchasing the Groupon DON'T DO IT. The menu consist of four items first off (which was all dry, unseasoned, and microwaved)  It wasn't disclosed that we had to buy an appetizer in order to use our Groupon. Glad we did because the "brunch" was terrible!! Thanks Jen for your horrible service. Hope your day gets better.
author: Kay B.

description: Wandered in here with a friend after a tour of AT&T Park.  The cheeseburger, fries & draft beers were awesome  The young woman bartender was great!  It's a friendly neighborhood hangout.  I will be back!
author: mary f.

description:
This place seemed very promising. My coworkers and I came here for a few drinks and appetizers during the 5 inning of a Giants game. We ended up ordering over $300 worth of food and drinks. However, I have never been so disrespected and utterly upset at the way we were treated by the staff.

There was a pool table that had its cover on and we asked the bartender if we could play. She blatantly ignored us and went back to helping the regulars sitting at the bar top. There were a total of 10 people in the bar, 6 of them were myself and my group. We wanted to play pool so we took off the cover, there were no rules or signs stating that we couldn't play or use the table, so we went for it.

About 5 minutes later, the bartender that originally ignored us came rushing over. She called my coworker a drunk idiot and continued to cuss at him and our group. She told us that we were making her job more difficult than it needed to be. She then grabbed the pool cues and threw them by my coworker's feet and saying extremely unprofessional things about us like if we weren't even standing there.

She then continues to tell everyone in the bar including the people at the bar, the other bartenders, and the bouncer about how idiotic we are. So we don't let it bother us and continue playing pool. I guess this made her really upset because she comes back to us to cuss at us some more. Then the bouncer comes over to us and explains that they typically don't allow people to play pool while the Giants' game is on because it gets too crowded. Then he tells us that he has to kick us out because we made the bartender really upset.

Her behavior just didn't make any sense to me. If she knew we weren't supposed to be playing pool at the time, then why did she bring out the cues? Also, there were no instructions about when we could play, so she could have easily come up to us and explained it, just like the bouncer did.

Overall, horrendous experience and I will never recommend this place to anyone.
author: Theo T.

description: There's a girl bartender who treats everyone awful. It's a pathetic display of service. I live two blocks away and you couldn't pay me or anyone I know to go here. Awful bar food. Awful service if you get the girl!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Checked this place out while bar hopping and it was so full of people but I believe it was because the Warriors game was on.  I really liked how they have the different games in the back and all the good music they played.  Decently priced drinks so I definitely can't complain.
author: Christina M.

description: Stopped in before heading to the Giants game! From the bouncer - I mean door man - to the waitress, bussers, & bar tenders, this place rocks!! Lots of tv screens, friendly patrons & quick service!! Prices are reasonable compared to others in the area! Cant wait to go back!!
author: Anjanette S.

description: Polo grounds is a great place to stop in for a game. I caught a warriors game there at the bar. It was easy to get seated, clientele was friendly, and the bartenders chimed in for a conversation about player injuries. Their food is top notch! Had their pupu platter and I was glad I made the choice!
author: Gladys M.

description: I purchased the brunch/bottomless mimosa Groupon. The bartender was very friendly and the mimosas were definitely bottomless. The food was not good. Bland and dry. I wouldn't be back here again to eat, but the bar itself is nice so I would come back here to drink.
author: Haley R.

description:
Years walking past Polo Grounds wishing for a decent place to get a beer by the park. With an hour to kill before the game, we made our way past the crowds of people to have a beer. Although the bar was packed, we were lucky enough to get a table. If you think you can grab a table to enjoy a beer - think again. Tables are reserved for customers ordering food, so after looking over their menu we ordered half a dozen wings, fries and two beers.

We didn't come in thinking we'd grab some food, kudos to Polo Grounds on making a bit more money off the AT&T crowd. Coors Light was $5 for a pint or you could get a pitcher for $20 which has roughly 4 beers. Rather than have our beer sit at the table and rise in temperature, we ordered beers as needed. 10 to 15 minutes later our appetizers came out and although I didn't indulge in the wings, I was told they were great. I did, however, try the fries and they were better than expected: seasoned, flavorful, and crispy.

Service was great beginning to end which was very surprising considering the large crowd. At one point, our waitress forgot to bring me a beer and was quick to apologize and didn't charge me for the beer. A very nice gesture that was factored in when leaving her tip. With a great layout, plenty of beer, TVs, specials, and great service, Polo Grounds is one of the better (and cheaper) places to drink and eat before, during or after the game.

Ambiance/Decor: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Price: $$
Overall: 4/5

Pros:
+ Across the street from AT&T Park
+ Full bar with specials (non game days)
+ Food menu available with table service
+ Tasty appetizers (wings and fries)
+ Great service
+ Reasonable beer pricing ($5 for Coors Light pint; $20 Coors Light pitchers)
+ Credit/debit accepted
+ Wells Fargo ATM next door

Cons:
- Bar will undoubtedly be busy during game days
author: Alexander E.

description:
If you want the most mediocre sports bar experience come here. If you want a garbage bar keep come here. If you want to be unsatisfied come here.

Service was pretty bad and the dude was a prick. I guess $3 pabst is alright in sf
author: Sayan S.

description:
Final playoff game (football), this place gets HELLA PACKED. Since we are regulars our section (several tables) were already RSVP'd for us when we arrive. Feeling special!! We even had our own server AND she was like our sister - half Filipino waitress rocking short hair!! She took care of all 35 of us with food, drinks, and extra company. On point with her service. If you see this, Come roll with us next yr!!! Literally, game day practically all tables were RSVP'd and people were watching from outside in. Place was SO fun.

- good food
- cheap prices on drinks and food 
- lots of TVs with audio 
- great atmosphere during the big games 

Always walk by the joint, now it's grown on me!!!
author: Jane A.

description: It was awesome to find a place in SoMa close to Caltrain that wasn't crazy crowded!  I could actually talk to my friend and we could hear each other without shouting.  However, there is probably a reason for the lack of crowds.  Food, drinks, and service were just "okay" and decor is sort of dark and uninviting.  We tried the "Amaze-rolls" which were like fried pulled-pork egg rolls.  These were recommended by the bartender and I liked the crispiness, but the flavor was just average.  They had wine on tap (nice), but ordering one was not easy.  The bartender kept disappearing around the large bar, and seemed to spend most of her time paying attention to the bar-back she was working with instead of the customers. I would come back here as a convenient place to meet someone and talk over a drink, but I wouldn't bring someone here if I was looking for an impressive experience.
author: Sheri W.

description: This place has the best vibe! I have spent my birthday here every year for the past 3 years. It has been a wonderful place to go and hang out before concerts and games. The deals are GREAT and the service is EXCELLENT. Love this place.
author: Nina A.

description: This is a nice bar to grab a drink at before the game, but the prices are just too high for me make this my regular bar for this area. Beers range in price from $6 for domestic draft to around $8 for craft brew, with cocktails starting at right around $9 for basic well drinks.The mood is very lively in here, plenty of good times to be had, but just know that you always pay for the experience, i'd personally rather make the trek to 21st Amendment to get my money worth.
author: Joseph A.

description:
I normally don't write reviews, but felt it necessary to warn others in case this establishment is running a scam. 

Came here for trivia night on thurs and opened a tab with the woman bartender since its a $15 min charge on a card. When it came time to close my tab they couldn't find my card anywhere. Obviously these things happen so I left my information thinking my card could turn up. They also promised to take care of my tab so nothing should be charged to my card. Cool right?? 

I didn't cancel my card right away but kept an eye on any activity. Right away I noticed that the bar did indeed charge my card for my tab. The next day I saw my card used at a Staples so now I'm going through the hassle of canceling my card and updating all my payment information. 

So I just want people to be careful as this seems to be a pretty unprofessional and shady establishment. Start a tab at your own risk!

PS...I will say though that the tater tots are great!
author: Kathy L.

description:
I'm basing this on the service...or rather the lack there of. 

I'm sitting here, looking at the bartender who clearly doesn't give a rats ass about new customers. It's been 10 minutes and he hasn't even greeted us. 

Now upon greeting us, low and behold he's so trashed it's no wonder he didn't want to serve us, he couldn't even think right when telling us about another place that had an open kitchen, let alone think about making a drink right!

It's safe to say me and my friend will never be going there again.
author: Katarina F.

description:
This place is a dive, but not even a cool dive like some of the uber-unique places around this fabulous city.  I'm sure it has a nice crowd on game days since the ballpark is right around the corner.  However, when we popped in a Tuesday night it was dead. 

Mental note:  There are plenty of TVs around, so I'm sure this will be packed during football season. 

The highlight of the night was by far the cheap tacos for Taco Tuesday.  Small beef and chicken street tacos are available for $1 each and Tecate is available in a can for $2.  

Meh, maybe I'll be back to check out the nachos or if I'm in the 'hood for baseball game.
author: Andrea H.

description: A convenient spot to grab a drink before the game.  Always seem to end up here before going into the park.  It gets hectic and you likely will need to wait for a drink or a table, but before a game that is kind of customary.  Ambiance is nice tho, makes you wana get drunk, so they are doing something right.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Great place to either start or end your Giants game journey! The drinks were good (I don't remember), bathrooms clean (I remember). 

Oh wait they have food?? What the...? Seems like others dig it so I have to put that on my list of things to do on my next visit. 

Marco!
author: Carla F.

description: Second time here, first time I didn't have a good experience the bartender was extremely rude and I think she might have even been wasted it was a Wednesday day time shift!! But let me tell you the bartender today Jen was freaking awesome the food was amazing we had the nachos that I could for sure eat everyday of my life and be a fatty!!  She was extremely present in every way and I will do my best to only come in for her shifts when I can make it out this way! 5  to you Jen way to mark your territory on this fine establishment  ;)
author: David J.

description:
Went there on 5.8.15 bouncer did a great job keeping control of the crowd, a couple drunk idiots tried to get in with no success. On another note, For over priced drinks I expect better service. 
 The female bartender seemed oblivious and impersonal. Meaning pay more attention to the customer needs and less time on her cell phone.
author: Amy I.

description: Awful service, decent food and beers. Blonde at the bar wanted to talk more about her orange panties with guys at the bar, than serve other patrons....Go Cubs!!
author: Jeff M.

description:
Not the best sports bar out there but pretty good bar. Great staff though, drinks priced right, there's food if you want, 1 coin-op pool table, chill atmosphere. Can be pretty tight/loud/stuffy during game days but which wateringhole around the ballpark isn't??

"I'll be Bach"
author: Jen J.

description: In town for business.  Stopped in to watch NBA Game 5.  Cool vibe, good draft beer options.  Surprisingly the bar food was excellent....not your typical frozen-to-fried fare.  We had wings, tater tots, fries, chicken rolls (?).....basically everything on the app sample platter.  It was all delicious.
author: Sean H.

description: The bartender is uber sensitive Lili, takes offense real easy (picked-on) n is basically authority extreme dude. The Bouncers love to push and shove patrons deemed "rowdy". It's Fans who love to talk smack!  As soon as sensitivity guy feels unloved he calls his goons to intervene. Personally hope This place goes broke from tweedle dee and dum bouncer, chumps
author: B A.

description: This is the best place to pre game before a giants game with all the best fans in the area.  This is THE Spot in SOMA for fun, drink and laughts.  Party on POLO Grounds.  See you later tonight.
author: Jimmy M.

description: Best place to have a beer and bite before a Giants game; service is amazing and bartenders are very helpful and actually answer your question and don't reply by saying "everything is good in the menu", they tell you what's poplar (steak nachos)!
author: Santana C.

description: I used to come here when I worked by here - if you work in SOMA this is a cool place to go for trivia! The food and drinks are standard bar food. The service is standard too. Also a place to go before the baseball game!
author: Foodeater F.

description: First visit here ... not disappointed !! Started with appetizers of housemate potato chips and onion dip - served piping hot and they were delicious. Just finished them when entrees arrived, a chicken sandwich with tater tots for side, bowl of chili and a Cobb salad (no chicken or bacon for me, though). The chicken sandwich was delicious and well dressed with sliced vegetables. Tater tots were comfort food good, with a spicy ketchup like sauce and a hard to describe but good "cheese" sauce - forgot to ask what that one was.  The salad was great, with nice selection of veggies and a hard boiled egg. Extra blue cheese was just right. The chili was well seasoned and meaty - small bowl was perfect size. At lunch you order at the bar, which had lots of workers enjoying a libation before their meal. Or, a beer for their meal ! Hard to tell sometimes. We opted for iced tea, and sat at a table away from bar. The service was quick and attentive, but after second refill and after we had finished lunch and sat for a while the single bartender/waitress was hard to find. We finally went to bar to pay, although one more iced tea before the road would've been just right. So, service could be a tad more attentive - although the service we had was quick and courteous. Televisions (muted) showed 2 futbol (ummm - soccer!) games, and noise was minimal. Ambience was very nice, very relaxing. We'll be back !
author: Mark K.

description:
Love this spot. My local pub. The food is pretty good. 50c wing Wednesdays and dollar street taco Tuesdays. 

Enjoy a pint or ten and a game of pool. Staff super friendly and professional. Only downside is they don't have a huge draft selection.
author: Duncan B.

description:
The Polo Grounds was the name of several stadiums in NY including the one for the New York Giants before they moved to San Francisco. Fast forward to today, Polo Grounds is now a lively pre-game watering hole. 

Speaking of games... If you've been to a game and noticed somewhat inebriated but excited fans, they probably did Irish car bombs at the Polo Grounds before entering the ballpark. Yes it's that kind of bar. It might take a while to squeeze through the masses to get to the bar but it's a fun pro-Giants crowd. 

Not the cheapest drinks in town - my Anchor Steam was $6 but still a bargain compared to the ballpark. Next time I'm back, I wanna try some of their braised pork masa bites. Now if only I can find some World Series tickets...
author: Jon L.

description:
Great bar to hit before a baseball game!  The beer list is impressive, and features a lot of California beer that, as a tourist, I enjoyed thoroughly.  
The food was delicious, especially the wings.  Definitely top 5 best wings I've ever had.  Sandwiches were very good too, but I would stick with the apps.
My one complaint would be the service.  Our waitress was wonderful, but I'm pretty sure she was covering the entire bar.  On a night with a baseball game across the street, this isn't a great idea.  But next time I am in San Fran I will definitely come back for those wings!
author: Mallory D.

description: The strongest margarita I've ever had. yummy chili fries, The bartenders are so friendly. Very nice atmosphere.
author: Pam Y.

description:
I don't like to leave bad Yelps. But after tonight, the 4th of July, I will because the bartender working tonight should not have his job. I equally judge all places and as a bartender myself, I feel I need to let the owners know how bad of an employee this guy was. I can not understand how people like the guy working tonight can even work in SF! Along with the girl who talked a lot about how she works there.. You all need on the job training! I understand, it's the 4th of July. I hate working holidays too, but when I come in to a place and could have gone across the street for douchebag service and wasted my money, at least serve me drinks! There was 11 people, including the cool door guy/bouncer, myself and my boyfriend. I start a tab, but after I have to ask you for my drink as you're on your phone behind the beer taps, and serving the guy who came in 5mins after me and only wanted a blue moon.. Sorry that you were more preoccupied but your a bartender! Serve me my drink! 
Long story short, I will probably come back here, because being drunk at Giants games is the ONLY way this place makes/is still in business. But now that I know two of the bartenders who work there, I guarantee I will not go back if I see them working, I'll go pay $20 for a shot across the street instead of $12 for a terrible experience. I'm just glad it's not O'Neils anymore, I'd feel bad to know that name is part of the terrible bar experience they offer. If the guys needs to learn how to bartend, I'll teach him, gladly. But I still tipped him, only because I'm not a jerk, but learn how to do your job!
author: Becky S.

description: If I could do no stars, I would. Don't get the tuna salad. The tuna is gray and the salad is overdressed. If not for the fresh cilantro, it would have been inedible. The sweet garlic wings are delicious! The pulled pork came with cole slaw and was dry for pulled pork. I would NOT eat here again.
author: Jess A.

description:
I want to give this spot 3.5 stars. The location is great, super close to Willy Mays Plaza at the ballpark. Music and drinks are good. It gets a bit crowded but there are tables and you might get one if you're there early or get lucky.

I am giving 4 stars because I ordered food here for the first time last week and it was great. A western BBQ burger with crispy fresh seasoned fries. Split it with someone and it was delicious. I didn't realize they had food because I've only pregamed here before but now that I know that it's burgers are comparable to Pete's I'll eat here more often.
author: Marty J.

description:
I'm back on board with Polo Grounds. 

The food is good and has a great selection. The beers are always fresh and they rotate in new ones regularly. The bartenders make the place and are one the main reasons we return regularly (Hi Mark!)

Highly recommend!
author: Sam M.

description:
Great bar to go to near the park. I like the crowd actually (someone said it draws a weird crowd?) but they're energetic!! I like it, lol. Everyone drunk and high-fiving each other. (Compared to when I went to Lucky Strike and no one really cheered that hard..)

Service did the best they could even when it was super busy and constantly checked up on us. Food was decent. Gets really crowded though, so if you hate standing on game days, then don't come here. But like I said, the atmosphere is awesome!

No idea what this place is like when no games are on!!
author: Emily C.

description:
This place is one of my favorite bars in San Francisco. The bar staff is amazing, and the prices are great in comparison to the other bars around there. 
You have to get the seasoned fries! Bring a friend too, because the portions are huge. The tuna wrap is also crazy good. Seared Ahi Tuna for the win. 
Thanks for always being so awesome.
author: Sami B.

description:
Trashy little bar near the ball park... draws in a bunch of weirdos.  But hey, I can be a prissy bitch sometimes, so this isn't really my scene anyway.  

We came here because the lines everywhere else were full during one of the playoff games.  Drinks were awful and weren't even cheap.  Peeps were making out and grinding to the game... things got a little weird. 

Then, during game 2 of the world series, they were charging a $10 cover.  Other bars were charging covers, too, but if I'm paying cover anywhere, I'd rather it be at Pedros, where I can have room to breathe and not get hounded by creepers.

Redeeming quality?  Proximity to the gate.
author: Jennifer L.

description: My friend invited me here for Trivia night.  I came after my workout so missed the first half but it was interesting.  Their grill wasn't working and they still charged me full price for my Cobb salad even though it had no chicken in it.  They only had fried foods available.  Service was ok and there is a $10 minimum for credit cards (Cobb salad sans chicken was $11.50 full price).
author: Chris L.

description:
OK place.  Lots of tvs for the World Cup.  Good food, bright cheerful bartender.  Tater tots!!  And if you ask they will put chili on them!!!  
Not cheap, but ok prices for the area.  Parking sucks.  I have never been during a game day, but I imagine the place must be rockin'.
Charged me $3 for a coke.  Really?
author: Ken P.

description: I would give it five stars if Janine was always there. Janine(tall blonde) that works there is the best. Polite, funny, and knows here stuff.
author: Kurt F.

description:
Half a block away from AT&T park and is an ideal place to hang out after a game. Drinking your sorrows away after butt whooping is another reason to go! Especially when 2012 season has been so much of a disappoinement.

Drinks were decent price (Corona was $4), it can get a little jam packed, but the lines for the bathrooms were SUPER long! I even saw one of the news achor from Channel 2 there! A little small so seating can also be a pain.

It's a good place nearby AT&T park to hang out for a little bit. Especially after a loss =P
author: Ernesto D.

description: Close to Caltrain San Francisco station, these guys are open until late. So if you are waiting for the last train and find no other place opened, well, this is the place to go.
author: Amanda G.

description:
This place has got the perfect location just across the street from the Willie Mayes Gate. It is the perfect blend of dive bar and a night on the town. It's got the small town college bar feel, with cool bartenders who are personable and prices that are not ridiculous. 

Dress casual or not. Good times! Cheers
author: Jen C.

description:
I would now like to echo the sentiments of others... this is a solid pre game spot, although I'd recommend hopping around a bit. There are tons of great places within walking distance from AT&T Park, and this one is just ok. 

My honey and I split an order of tasty chicken tenders. Food prices are average. I was really bummed about my Laguanitas being flat, but the bartender let me exchange it for another tasty IPA on tap. Good service and food= solid 3 stars.
author: Yvonne C.

description:
I'm so sad to say...this is no longer the best spot for wings. The new chef changed the menu and they raised the prices.

The old wings were perfect. Perfectly crispy. Delicious vinegar-y buffalo sauce.

The new wings are so damn spicy you can't even finish them. From a business perspective, I think this isn't good for revenue. With the old wings you could keep ordering and ordering. The new wings hurt your mouth, intestines and everything in between. 

There's a new wing sauce which is pretty tasty, but it's a sweet asian-style sauce. When I'm in the mood for good ol' fashioned buffalo wings, a sweet asian sauce is disappointing.

The only thing that has remained a constant high point for the polo grounds as they went through the remodel: The bartenders. Truly some of the nicest people in the SF service industry.  They're always kind, funny, accomodating and damn good at their jobs.
author: Shanee B.

description: I visited San Francisco last month with my father.  Fresh off a flight from NY we headed to a Giants game and found this place on the walk.  We were intrigued by the NY reference and were glad we stumbled it.  For a Friday night before a game it wasn't uncomfortably packed and the servers were friendly & attentive.  Seemed like a great menu for pub grub standards.  Wings were top notch and I respect any place that puts tots on the menu.  Perfect place to go before the game.
author: Matt Y.

description: Im not sure what this place is like on Game day but i do know what it's like on a late Wed night. Introduced to me by the Saison crew, we headed over for a post service drink. Sat at the bar and conversed with the bartender and one of the regular patrons. Not too crowded, a slightly gritty vibe. I can see why people like this for post work drinking as theyll take you all the way till 2am when the lights come on. Oh man im getting kicked out of the bar!
author: Kim N.

description:
This was a good stop to make before the Giants game. The Warriors playoff game was on tv, tons of Giants fans were streaming in for beers and yet somehow we managed to score seats right at the bar with a view of everything.

I was quite impressed with the beer selection here, from the taps that included Ballast's Sculpin and Big Eye, to the bottles that offered Bear Republic and Dogfish Head. I could have stayed in here all day just drinking different beers. Plus, as far as I remember the prices were reasonable. 

Also, the service was pleasant, so I really have no complaints about this place.
author: Clayton A.

description: Nothing that special about this place, though they were open on Thanksgiving.  We came in for a quick one before heading to the Cirque show down the road.  The bartender was nice (& Pretty), though a little on the slow (Service wise) side, since the bar wasn't packed and she took a good few minutes of doing nothing before coming over to get our order.
author: Bryanna P.

description: A friend and I stopped in here for a drink this past Friday night before the giants game.  We had been to a few other bars but decided to stay at this one since they had Blue Moon (yes!) and none of the other bars around did (weird). This place, like the others, was packed with Giants fans and was hard to find sitting room. We finally got a couple of bar stools and decided to order some food. We didn't have much time till the game started so we just ordered the nacho plate. O...M...G!! BEST NACHOS EVER. I'm not sure what it was, it looked like a standard plate of nachos but it was HELLA good. And they got them out super quick.. I would definitely stop in and order them again.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Polo Grounds is always one of my favorite pre-game spots before Giants games. (Said me and every other review.) 

It's one of the few South Beach bars with the space to handle the crowds that ensue before game time, they have great beers on tap and a fun bartending team getting you and your fellow fans riled up. The bar food prices have been jacked up since the rebrand, which is the only thing keeping this from getting four stars, but until I break my addiction to stadium hot dogs, I'll keep coming here for the beer.
author: Kevin B.

description: You are a FOOL if you come here and not try the nachos OMG it's a party going on in your mouth AND add a blue moon. I'm coming back
author: Ceci L.

description:
BEWARE!!! the men's bathroom door opens OUT, so if you are leaving the ladies' room, you may get knocked over as some drunk guy opens the door at full speed.  I'm pretty sure I got a concussion when I was leaving the ladies' room as some belligerent man slammed the door at full speed into my temple, torso and foot.  I am still hurting two days later.  Seriously, someone could be killed if the door hits them hard enough in the temple.  I'm too scared to return

the bartenders and service were great.
author: Erin G.

description: Pretty cheap pitchers (17 dollars) and near AT&T park. Worth coming to on game day or after work. Lots of space.
author: Ruobin W.

description: Love this local feeling place.  The best service, wings are great. I plan to stumble through the menu.
author: Sandy N.

description:
Im gonna give Polo Grounds 4 stars because their wings are GODDAMN DELICIOUS. I would have never expected it from this unassuming bar across the street from AT&T park, but their food is pretty darn good. Wednesday is wing night, 50 cents per wing. Also try the tacos on taco night and the fried pickles!

I'm sure it gets pretty packed here during the baseball season. But during off season, it's a pretty chill place to just have a drink and eat some bar food. It's pretty spacious and it doesn't have that trendy/crowded/loud SF thing going on so it's a perfect watering hole with your friends or coworkers. They also have a bunch of TVs showing sports. 

With all that good stuff said, don't expect good mixed drinks here. I've heard that they water down their liquor and their mixed drinks taste really crappy (like an old fashioned, but what the hell am I doing ordering an old fashioned at a bar like this?) Stick with beer and wings and you'll be fine.
author: Julie K.

description:
I've never eaten at Polo Grounds and I've only had beers there a couple of times.  So ... why the five star review?  Here's why.  Last Sunday night a friend of mine & I stopped in for post-game drinks.  This afternoon an envelope containing two checks that I thought I'd lost arrived in the mail.  The bartender sent them with a nice note explaining that I'd left the envelope on the bar.  

Now THAT'S customer service and I will be sure to return!!!
author: Debbie F.

description: I was at polo grounds on a game day. I had a cocktail server, Ryan, aka cutest bartender there. He was Incredible, not just at work but after work too;). He said he usually bartended after but he had to give me the "real" polo after hours experience
author: Seth M.

description: This is my favorite place to go before and after the giants games! The staff is amazing, they always make sure you are well taken care off. Plus the bartenders are always on par with their drinks and know how to keep the party going!
author: Joe B.

description: sf giants vs oakland a's...a bite before april second game...seating plenty at five:thirty pm...filling up quickly past six pm before game...no happy hour on game day...$seven guinness a hefty price tag...corned beef sandwich a bargain price at $nine with a mountain of seasoned fries...corned beef cooked crispy...sauerkraut loaded...thousand dressing light...salty and tangy flavors between toasty bread...a good sandwich...crispy skinny fries seasoned good...good meal and enjoying a simple dinner before sf giants victory game...sf four and oakland two...giants win battle of the bay, bay bridge series..
author: Hen A.

description: Its a typical sports bar. I came here with friends after watching the giants loose on a early Sunday afternoon game. They were blasting an awesome 90's playlist.
author: Beni R.

description:
Use to be Oneils Irish Pub, no longer has the pub/neighborhood/ home feel to it.
Ordered fries and onion rings that took 20 mins. Came to us cold. They ended up throwing them back into the fryer so they were extra crispy, almost like cardboard. 
Locks in bathrooms broken
+ side there is a pool table
negatives: music was loud, squeeling music, even a little new orleans like. So confusing - Muse, Jazz, 40s music ???

Don't think we'll be coming back
author: Mario M.

description:
Great little dive for those in the AT&T Park area that would like to avoid the neighboring cavernous corporate bars. The food is pretty dang good for pub fare.  If you want pork belly in a vinagrette reduction, go to 25 Lusk, but if you're okay eating some phenomenal (cheap!) tacos, burgers, and fries PG's is the place.  Pool table, juke box, and Golden Tee, are all available. I've been to Thursday night trivia and that seems pretty fun too. 

Again, its a great little bar that stays pretty mellow except for the Giants pre/post game shenanigans, in which case its definately a rowdy homer bar, but some fans love that type of atmosphere.
author: A.D. R.

description:
Polo Grounds has some of the best bar food in San Francisco, hands down. Seriously, give their menu a look.

I've had pretty much everything major on their menu, Grilled Cheese Sandwiches, Onion Rings, Buffalo Wings...TACOS...the good stuff.

Speaking of Wings, on Wednesday nights, wings are 50 cents a pop...and on Tuesdays, they have tacos for $1 a pop.

See you there.
author: Trav M.

description: Pay with CASH. Understaffed and the DRUNK waitress will lose your card.
author: Raptor Jesus C.

description: Fresh to the city. Tending was slow until I tipped 100% on a $6 beer. Looking for a dope bar close to my new place. Not bad but this isn't it.
author: Joe H.

description: Not a bad spot for a quick drink before a Giants game. A little tight to get a spot at the bar especially before a game, but we were greeted right away and got our shots quickly. I've also been here after a game and it can be just as packed. But let's face it if you're coming here chances are you're just looking for a pre or post game drink.
author: Renee P.

description: Best neighborhood bar near the ballpark. Food is good and everything is cheap. Staff are fun and down to earth. Can get a little loud, and on game days can be hectic. Go to spot.
author: Tamas G.

description:
This is THE place for pre or post drinking for Giants games.  

My friends and I were lucky enough to get a table and we had a really good time (or maybe all the beer we had on the train and at the game caught up with us).  The bartenders were all cute girls and super nice.  There's only one bathroom  which I can imagine is annoying when it's busy.

I'll see you next game, Polo Grounds!
author: Kelsey R.

description: A nice, simple little bar, really close to the ballpark. I went there one thursday after Lucky Strike closed, and had a couple of drinks. Really cheap, and the people were nice!
author: Zach H.

description: This review is for Jeanine my friends and I received the WORST service from her I've ever gotten from a bartender. She was so rude. I would not want to come back here again because of her.
author: Heather B.

description: Anyone coming in here with entitled expectation will be a mean person and write a bad review. Other normal humans will enjoy the jocular spirit of the barkeep, and the relative lack of pretension or intensity of a stupid, overly busy bar that doesn't need me.  This place didn't only need me, they welcomed me and were happy to have me.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: Was walking around the area this past December. Walked in when noticing a sign for the Wednesday Happy Hour. $.50 wings and $12 pitcher of beer. We were really trying to get warm and kill some time, so it seemed perfect. The bartender at first was mean, which surprised me because everywhere else we had been in San Francisco the service was amazing. Got the buffalo wings, spicy and tasty with a side of fries which were also good. Toward the end the bartender was friendly. Cool bar for locals that have different types of happy hours daily and perfect to watch a game.
author: Lili M.

description: After a long drive from Sacramento we needed a place to chill for 2 hours before they would start letting people into AT&T Park for the Giants game. We met up with our friends and had a couple of drinks all at about $5 each. This place is conveniently located about half a block up third street from Willie Mays Plaza. There are several TVs, beers on tap and considerably clean bathrooms. One of the favorite things about this place is they have Magners Cider in the bottle. I'm not much of a beer drinking so any establishment that has cider is a winner to me!
author: Cindy S.

description: Great SOMA bar with awesome and friendly bartenders! There is weekly trivia on Thursdays and drink specials thru-out the week. It can be a bit crowded busy during giants games. There's a jukebox and pool table in the back. It's a fun place any day of the week.
author: PJ K.

description:
I have been going here on Thursday for trivia for the past few years.  It's a great place for trivia and has good food. I recommend the chicken sandwich.

But what really keeps our team coming back is Kyl.  She is an incredible, hard working bar tender who always has a smile.
author: J E.

description: Went on a game day and it was packed.  Enjoyed sitting at the bar and the staff was very friendly.  The food was good enough but it was a pretty limited selection as far as fried food versus anything else.  I think the ballpark has better food options but I did enjoy my food for what I ordered.  Good beer selection and good at keeping the drinks full and coming.  A little small but a place to hang out... good people and good atmosphere.
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
Superb Location, Great menu, awesome staff, added MORE HD TV's!!!  Under new ownership and its shows!  Can't say enough about this place other than it has to compete with the young hipsters at Momo's and Pete's.  Nothing against Pete's but this is more of the true Giants Fan local Pub!   Simple and Real!
#SFBarçaSF
author: Jean B.

description: How can this place only have 4 reviews???  This place is always packed before and after Giants games.  I finally stopped in here when I had some time to kill before a game.  They have plenty of beers on tap, great prices on drinks, and your typical bar food, of which the fish and chips looked pretty good.  I know people like to drink at the game, but why spend that kind of money on beer at the stadium, when you can get liquored up here for half the price before you go?  There's quite a few HD TV's and they have some really cool orange Giants pint glasses, of which they stopped serving in when we we got our second round of drinks.  They probably have fans take them which is a smart move as it started to fill up in there when we left.
author: Scott F.

description: I was charged someone else's tab including my own in separate transactions, and when I called to get it resolved the manager acted like she was going to work with me at first, but then when I tried calling back no one would answer the phone, the manager would be busy, or gone, and I have yet to receive my money back. I will never be coming back to this place again. Plus the service is slow: game day or not.
author: Neil P.

description: I met some friends before a Giants game earlier this week. I had never been here before. I usually have my pregame warmup at Public House at AT&T.Good selection of beers on draft. My buddy ordered a few different appetizers. Nachos, wings, stuffed jalapenos and crispy spring rolls. All were good but not great. The server was on it. She was quick and friendly. I would go back but not make a special trip..
author: Butch P.

description: I went on a Thursday night and they had trivia which was fun and pretty hoping.  I order chicken tenders with tots ($1 extra) instead if the regular fries.  The bartender was really nice and proudly represented the east bay (wore an A's shirt and Raiders hat) which was awesome and I respect.  He most importantly suggested 805 to go with my food when I asked him.  Other than our table being sticky and not wiped down when we got to it (we saw they were busy, so we took care of it) it was a fun place to hangout with friends, play trivia and win a free pint!  Be aware that there is only one restroom for each case gender so there will likely be a line.
author: Maribel C.

description: I went in right before watching my first baseball game ever. I had the best cheeseburger I've had in a really long time, actually the best I've had in SF since moving here in March. And to top it off I treated myself to a Cup of Awesome while enjoying the good vibes all around me.
author: Carolina P.

description: Shhh.... Don't tell anyone else how awesome this place is.
author: Lindsay O.

description: Everytime we come to San Francisco we go to this bar! We absolutely love it. Great appetizers!  Great drinks and fabulous sports bar atmosphere!
author: Gina H.

description: Great sport bar awesome food with drinks great price what else can you ask for, very clean
author: Mony K.

description: Terrible bar, terrible food.  It was not busy at all, took 45 minutes to get a burger and salad, then another ten minutes to get silverware.  Never had a single person check on us.  Oh, and don't pay attention to any drink specials written on the wall, they will charge you 40% more than the "special price" listed.
author: Ricgard D.

description: Not a bad place to watch any SF sports games. Food was okay, decent selection of beer. The service was terrible though. All the bartenders seemed to be hanging out after their shifts, kept grabbing food from the kitchen, and drinking tons. But then would go and bus empty tables. It was strange. My friend and I sat at a table because the bar was full. We weren't helped at all, until my friend went and found the only bartender actually working to help us with food and drinks. I'd only go back to get drinks.
author: K W.

description: Don't show a World Series game charge 10 bucks up get in and have rude ass people working for you! The worst ever! Especially the rude ass "security" at the bathroom
author: Selena P.

description: Meh. Rolled through here mostly to check out the memorabilia. They had some cool pictures of the old New York Giants baseball Polo Grounds which I thought was kinda cool, but there were only a few. This place gets ridiculous during games. We were at the game but dipped in here on the way to the parking garage somewhere around the 7th inning. IDK, I dont like this whole area very much. I prefer the Reds Java House/ Hi Dive area but they closed off the parking on the pier so we ended up here. All in all, not enough to get me to go back.
author: Morris D.

description: Great place for lunch and friends. Especially if you want to watch the game. I love the happy hour prices and this is probably one of the few places where you can find tater tots on the menu! The bartenders there are all awesome. I was there yesterday with a small group of girls for a mini reunion. Sena served us and she made a delicious bloody mary! She is a very attentive bartender and I always appreciate that. The food was sent out quickly and was delicious as well. I'd go back more often if I lived in the hood. Easily five stars!
author: Bibi B.

description: So my bf and I came in here to wait for some of our friends. We ordered food and drinks. I must say that the food is good and good portions as well. We had really good service by the waitress. Will come back after a giants game. I subtracted a star because the tvs are positioned where my neck was hurting, so I had to sit next to my bf to watch the tv.
author: arlene d.

description: Giants opening day, not too busy and 10+ beers on tap. Decent food selection and great service. Daily promos from taco Tuesday and trivia. Solid place! Will come back for any game
author: Rob M.

description: Steps from the ball park and Caltrans, in three visits this sports bar has never failed to deliver.  A great hambuger and good pub food, not to mention a nice beer selection, makes this a good place for a late lunch.   We've never been there at game time and the single waitress/bartender does yeoman service for the small number of guests (we arrive from the bus station after lunch hour) but they almost certainly  would do well at regular hours.  A nice place.
author: Bill J.

description: If there were a 0 star option, I would give this place that. Perhaps it should get at least one star because they did have booze. And perhaps my dislike mostly comes from the fact that my brother screwed up the CalTrain times, so we had an hour to burn. But my disappointment here is mostly with the jukebox. Death metal. And lots of it. I put in several of my dollars in a desperate attempt to make it end. Rolling Stones, The Beatles, anything. I think I hit Counting Crows at one point just to make it stop. I even paid extra to "make [my] song next!" All to no avail. And now I have nightmares because of it.
author: Sasha N.

description: Damn, bartender - you make a stroooong vodka soda! In the state that I was in (1.5 bottles of champers deep on an empty stomach consumed on the train ride up to the Giants game), drinks usually all taste like water. Yet you, sir bartender, made me a simple vodka soda that would wake up an 80-year old Russian. Hats off to you, Mr. bartender - you have earned my respect! Sorry I couldn't stay longer, had to try to actually watch some baseball.
author: Anna R.

description: Went here last night to meet up with some friends.  Bouncer and bartender were extremely rude to my coworker.  I will not be back.  The rude and stuck up bouncer was hitting on every belligerantly drunk girl in there.  They clearly had been overserved.  Please read my friend's review below.  It's well written, and it really happened.  Unbelievable! There's no excuse for that kind of behavior.  The broken bathroom locks make this hell hole even less inviting then the Sunday night staff.
author: Panjit S.

description: So we stumbled upon this bar while walking around near AT&T park.  It was after the normal lunch crowd, so I don't know what it's normally like, but we had to walk to the bar to get our own menus and almost had to do the same thing to order.  Food was ok, nothing to write home about.  I did like my tacos, but I probably wouldn't go back.  Unfortunately, near there, you don't have many options.
author: Michelle O.

description: Good place. Bartender (Mark) is good and always alert to customers needs, he is quick and a big surprise that he is taking care of all the customers by himself at the bar. Good ambience. A little noisy but that's just because people are having a good time. Beer is good. Haven't had drinks but the way I've seen him work I bet they are good. My six piece buffalo wings, delicious by the way, came in in less than 5 min. And are cooked great.
author: Carlos H.

description: Swung in for a beer and a small bite before taking the stadium tour.  Place has plenty of beers on tap and bottles.  Small menu, though the bacon and blue lettuce cups were awesome with a beer.
author: J J.

description: I had to give it one star so I can rate the place. Under the new ownership and bartenders are even worse than a school of friggen' piranha . The new owner Kevin and his gang is known for buying bars in the city and turning them into absolute trash. He also owns the Fishbowl or as we local call it the "Cesspool".  Why pay ball park prices for your drinks and get all the attitude? You are better off drinking at the ball park at $9 dollar beers then giving these your hard earned cash and get no respect for it. Bar owners and staff in SF need to realize we have tons of choices in terms of establishments and this place should not be one of them.
author: vahid r.

description: Poor O'Neil's. I'd pick an Irish pub over a loud, run of the mill sports bar that caters to game crowds any day of the week. Isn't the sports bar market saturated around here anyway?
author: Ang F.

description: We pregamed here. Ok drinks. Nothing special. Lots of domestic beers. Service wasnt amazing. But it's a chill environment. I would find something more upbeat.
author: Jessica K.

description: Good people working here and a great place to grab a beer after work
author: Tom K.

description: Went to trivia night here. The drinks were cold, the food was okay...what more do you want from a bar like this? I'd go back for another trivia night for sure. Could do without the guys yelling like HGH-fueled morons at the TV, but that's why I generally avoid bars with TVs in the first place. I mean, it does seem like a bartender could point out that the REST of the room is not yelling. Or even watching the game. Otherwise, a good enough place.
author: Karen Z.

description: A friend of ours turned us onto this bar after Oktobrefest (see my review.)  It is a lively loud joint with friendly bouncers & bar tenders alike; we enjoyed sitting at one of their tables over a couple Stellas, watched the game on their Tvs, & had a good time with beers at a reasonable prices.  Keep up the good work guys.
author: Brian S.

description: Great bartenders, good food, plenty of TVs, and a pool table. Can't ask for much more out of a neighborhood bar.
author: D H.

description: Cheap drinks. If you're a single lady, all the guys hang out here when there's a game :) Right near AT&T and a good pre-game stop and sometimes and after game stop as well. Not as hoity-toity as Momo's or other local bars.
author: M S.

description: Came here after a work happy hour event at Lucky Strike. There ended up being at least 30 of us that walked over, and we were all pretty tipsy. They handled us like pros. No one ever felt like they were waiting and they were super friendly. I commend them on being able to handle our rowdy crowd.
author: Lauren D.

description: Loved the atmosphere! Great selection of draft beer. Bartenders were all really nice.
author: Melissa B.

description: If you want a good stiffy, get your ass to Polo Grounds. I once ordered a double there and it literally had a splash of mix in it.
author: Sheila B.

description:
Best Bar ever!! Close to ballpark- but you never have to wait in line! You never wait for  a drink! 

Awesome new food, including a "freak dog" covered in spicy mac and cheese and tater tots served with a cheese sauce! YUM! 

Drinks are great priced- they have TACO TUESDAYS, BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS, and DJ PURPLE DANCE KARAOKE on SATURDAY NIGHTS! Did I mention they also have a pool table!! 

Best bartenders ever!!!!
author: A H.

description: This is an great bar to get a drink before/after a Giants game. We went before a friday night game and there were plenty of people (but not too many), yet we still got served right away. The bar tenders are amazingly good at finding the people in the crowd around the bar who need a drink! It looks like a traditional pub, but it has flat screen TVs all over playing sports, so as far as sports bars go, I liked it better than most!  We went back after the game to wait out the traffic and it was hopping, but again not so packed that it annoyed me :)
author: Susan V.

description: They have a great beer selection, great fries, great tater tots, and a lot of televisions to watch sports. It can get very crowded but that is what you get when you are a block away from AT&T.
author: Knickerbocker R.

description: I work in the service industry and I know what it is like to be busy and then making yourself look busy. I went into this place for a couple reason,  I have been there before playing the  Golden Tee Golf game which has only the 2012 version, but still a great flat screen that goes with it. And because of a Christmas party that was held there. So I was familiar with it. Not the greatest service before and it gets worse. I went in there on June 1st before going to Dinner for some drinks. I could have went anywhere walked a couple block to get there. When I enter the Bartender who was not busy never acknowledge us sitting right in front of him and proceeded around the other side of the bar flipping the bird to other patrons at the end of the bar. It must have been about five minutes then we walked out, there was no Giants game and it was absurd his behavior. Went to Zeke's , even a bigger dive but was served within ten SECONDS!
author: Baaake H.
